subSubSection.paragraph: Large transparent ascidian most often attached to the side of a rock by means of a short but stout tunic stalk. In contrast to Dicopia or Megadicopia , this species is somewhat elongated laterally. The excurrent siphon is smaller in diameter than that of Dicopia .
